page.title: 14Farming in Wilton District
page.content: There are 6 farms in the area varying in size from 2,750 acres to 25 acres.A small proportion of the land is privately owned but most of it is rented from the Wilton Estate. The smallest farm is a dairy farm with 12 cows which produce 1000 gallons of milk per year each.Only one farm is exclusively arable, growing mainly wheat and barley. The other farms are mixed, growing crops such as cereals, roots (including potatoes) and hay and rearing animals such as beef cattle, sheep, pigs and,in one instance, trout. The largest farm is managed by the farmer with 7 other workers and the smallest by one man with extra help at weekends. All the farmers interviewed enjoyed their work and had been farming all their lives,following the tradition in their families.
